cause.description:
The Campaign for Cancer Prevention aims to innovate and effectively channel the most cutting-edge research and prevention strategies against cancer. The Campaign is an official partner of Brigham and Women's Hospital, a flagship hospital of Harvard Medical school.
The Campaign supports several of the world's largest and longest-running studies into understanding cancer causes and preventions. Several of the studies has helped lead the world in finding causes, preventions, and treatments for cancer for >30 years.
The Campaign was featured in NEWSWEEK Magazine and has directly supported innovative cancer research from Harvard.
HOW CAN YOU HELP?
FOLLOW on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/campaignprevent
JOIN the Campaign's 6 million person cause: http://www.causes.com/cancer
SHARE the cause on your wall for friends to join
INVITE all your friends by signing the 'Invite Pledge'
BECOME a fan: http://www.facebook.com/cancerprevention
Thank you for supporting the Campaign for Cancer Prevention.
Dr. Eric L. Ding Harvard Medical School Brigham and Women's Hospital Harvard School of Public Health
------------------------------------ ----------------------------
*YOUR DISEASE RISK calculator of different cancers (breast, colon, prostate, lung, ovarian, cervical, melanoma, uterine, etc), heart disease, stroke, diabetes, and osteoporosis http://www.diseaseriskindex.harvard.edu/
Did you know:
-1 person dies of cancer every 4 seconds in this world - every second of every day.
-1 out of 2 men, and 1 out of 3 women, will be diagnosed with cancer in their lifetime.
-Cancer the 2nd leading cause of death in the world, killing 7.6 million people each year.
-Ending cancer would improve the economy by $50 trillion.
In essence, cancer affects us all - via a parent, sibling, child, other relative, or a friend.
1. Cancer can be preventable and treatable-- someday nobody will die from cancer.
2. We can come together to understand and overcome cancer.
